title: PES of X and Y - neutral or negative ion

content.question: Which of the following can be inferred from the spectra?

choices.label: <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> has a larger nuclear charge than <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> has; therefore, <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is neutral and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is negatively charged.

<math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> has a larger nuclear charge than <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> has; therefore, <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is neutral and <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is negatively charged.

<math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> has a smaller nuclear charge than <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> has; therefore, <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is neutral and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is negatively charged.

<math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> has a smaller nuclear charge than <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> has; therefore, <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is neutral and <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is negatively charged.

content.answer: <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> has a smaller nuclear charge than <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> has; therefore, <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is neutral and <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is negatively charged.

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
